programme.title: Blitzkrieg: The Lightning War
programme.desc: By the late Summer of 1940 Nazi Germany controlled virtually all of Europe. Beginning in 1936 Germany employed a combination of political intimidation and a series of swift military attacks known as Blitzkrieg to overrun one country after another. Austria, Czechoslovakia, Poland, Norway, Denmark, Holland, Belgium and France all collapse before the onslaught of Hitler's seemingly invincible might.

programme.title: Battlezone WWII: The Nazis Strike
programme.desc: A history of Russian Conflict culminating in the struggle against the Nazi's in WWII.

programme.title: Combat War Channel
programme.desc: Valley Forge...Gettysburg...Wounded Knee...San Juan Hill...the Somme...Omaha Beach...Inchon...Saigon...Basra. Combat War Channel delivers the complete history of America and our allies at war as never before!

programme.title: Combat War Channel
programme.desc: Valley Forge...Gettysburg...Wounded Knee...San Juan Hill...the Somme...Omaha Beach...Inchon...Saigon...Basra. Combat War Channel delivers the complete history of America and our allies at war as never before!

programme.title: Battlezone: The Korean War
programme.desc: The Communist invasion of Korea which led to the entry of the US Forces into the conflict.

programme.title: Visions of War: The Korean War
programme.desc: Combat activities in Korea during November 20th through December 20th 1950. It was the largest amphibious evacuation in military history.

programme.title: Wartime Aircraft of the Fleet Air Arm
programme.desc: Showcasing some of the most significant aircraft types used by the Fleet Air Arm.

programme.title: Battlezone: The Korean War
programme.sub-title: Big Picture: Chinese Reds Enter the Korean War
programme.desc: In this The Big Picture we see American soldiers battling winter cold, as well as the Communist Chinese, in Korea. The film shows how soldiers saved thousands of lives with quick evacuations of wounded U.S. fighters in helicopters. Also included is a display of the finest weapons in the world -- the U.S. Army's.

programme.title: Battlezone: The Korean War
programme.sub-title: Big Picture: The First Forty Days in Korea
programme.desc: In this The Big Picture documentary film we watch as several companies of the 24th Division fight the Communist Chinese against great odds. They are fighting the first thrust across the 38th Parallel in Korea.

programme.title: Battlezone: The Korean War
programme.desc: In this issue Big Picture viewers will receive a firsthand account of how American artillery is employed in Korea. The film shows how American artillerymen fire ten shells for every one the Communists launch at our troops. Included in the film is a study of the Army's new atomic cannon...the 280mm gun.

programme.title: Visions of War: The Korean War
programme.desc: Combat activities in Korea, May 20th through June 20th 1951 - allied units push north as the tide of battle turns- airlift deliver supplies to the front lines.

programme.title: First to Fight
programme.desc: North Korea crosses the 38th Parallel and invades South Korea on June 25, 1950. The North pushes through initial defenses and captures Seoul and US and UN forces dig in at Pusan.

programme.title: Visions of War: The Korean War
programme.desc: Combat activities in Korea during the period of August 10th through September 20th 1952 covering landing on Wolmi Island and capture of Inchon.

programme.title: Visions of War: The Korean War
programme.desc: Combat activities in Korea during February 20th through March 20th 1951. The U.N. offensive continues - Operation Killer hampered by weather.

programme.title: Air Power
programme.desc: Every major power develops military jets post World War II. The race to break the sound barrier begins. War breaks out in Korea in 1950 ushering in the age of jet combat.

programme.title: History Of The Korean War
programme.sub-title: History of the Korean War Part One
programme.desc: This includes the history of the Korean War, more specifically the 38th Parallel. The 38th Parallel is referred to the part of Korea that divided the North from the South following WWII.

programme.title: Visions of War: The Korean War
programme.sub-title: The 24th Infantry Division in Korea - The Big Picture
programme.desc: The 24th Division was formed out of the old Hawaiian division shortly before Pearl Harbor, and it fought bravely in many decisive battles in the Southwest Pacific that followed. Follow the history of the 24th Infantry Division from their first difficult days of battle in Korea until November 1954, when the proud colors of the Division marched in Korea for the last time.

programme.title: Visions of War: The Korean War
programme.desc: Combat activities in Korea during the period of September 20th through October 20th 1952 including recapture of Seoul and capture of Pyongyang.

programme.title: Wings of Destruction
programme.desc: 'MiG Alley' is the name given by the U.S. Air Force pilots to the northwestern portion of North Korea, where the Yalu River empties into the Yellow Sea. During the Korean War, it was the site of numerous dogfights between U.S. fighter jets and those of the Soviet Union. As the site of the first large-scale jet-vs.-jet air battles, MiG Alley is considered the birthplace of jet fighter combat.

programme.title: Battlezone: The Korean War
programme.sub-title: Big Picture: United Nations Consolidate Below the 38th Parallel
programme.desc: Destruction of the Port of Hungnam...The withdrawal across the Han...U.N. defenses at Suwon...and air attacks on the Chinese border. Captain Zimmerman interviews two soldiers, Corporal Tom Miller who was a rifleman with the 1st Cavalry Division in Korea and Corporal James Jankowski of McDonald, Pennsylvania, who served with Company L in the Army's 2nd Division.

programme.title: Battlezone: The Korean War
programme.sub-title: Big Picture: The Army Combat Team
programme.desc: The Big Picture shows you what happens in one day of war. 'The Army Combat Team,' which has proved itself in the Korean fighting, is shown in action. Infantry, Artillery Armor and Army Aviation form a powerful offensive and defensive team of the 8th Army in Korea. The Big Picture focuses on the man and the machines of this team in the rugged terrain of the Korean peninsula.

programme.title: Visions of War: The Korean War
programme.desc: A variety of subjects covered by our cameras both in Korea and in the United States. Included are: The story of a Quartermaster Aerial Supply Company, and the story of the 8209 Mobile Army Surgical Hospital.

programme.title: Visions of War: The Korean War
programme.sub-title: The 1st Cavalry Division in Korea - The Big Picture
programme.desc: The Army on horseback that once was the United States Cavalry is no more, for our Army today is a mechanized force. But 'cavalry' is a proud word in military terminology and no one displays that pride more than the men of the 1st Cavalry Division. Today, these men of the division keep alive the cavalry's legendary tradition of bravery by fighting, when they are called upon.

programme.title: Battlezone: The Korean War
programme.desc: Covers the United States involvement with Korea and testing of Korean weapons. John Ford directed this film which is the only color documentary made during the Korean War.

programme.title: Visions of War: The Korean War
programme.desc: Covers the United States involvement with Korea and testing of Korean weapons. John Ford directed this film which is the only color documentary made during the Korean War.

programme.title: Battlezone: The Korean War
programme.sub-title: Big Picture: The Republic of Korea (ROK) Soldier
programme.desc: Through the Korean Military Advisory Group, the South Korean Army has been able to build itself up to the fourth strongest Army in the world. 'The Big Picture' shows the activities of the South Korean Army and its preparations for the future.

programme.title: The Amazing World of War Machines
programme.desc: Since the end of World War II, when the United States dropped the A-bomb on Japan, and the advent of the Cold War, the threat of nuclear destruction has never seemed far away. Although in recent times attempts have been made to slow or even stop nuclear proliferation, countries such as North Korea, China and Pakistan have continued to develop and test their own missiles.

programme.title: Battlezone: The Korean War
programme.sub-title: Big Picture: Truth is Our Defense
programme.desc: This is the story of the Army's Psychological Warfare activities in the Far East Command, primarily as a tactical weapon in Korea. We augment the effectiveness of our combat forces with the potent weapon of words. Through leaflets, shot by artillery shells or dropped from planes; through radio news and through loudspeakers mounted on tanks and jeeps, we send our messages of truth to the enemy.

programme.title: Combat War Channel
programme.desc: Valley Forge...Gettysburg...Wounded Knee...San Juan Hill...the Somme...Omaha Beach...Inchon...Saigon...Basra. Combat War Channel delivers the complete history of America and our allies at war as never before!

programme.title: The Crusade in the Pacific
programme.desc: After World War II, Korea is divided along the 38th Parallel. In the North, the Soviet Union influences a Communist government under Kim Il-sung. In the South, the United States shepherds a young Republic. The Korean peninsula is plunged into war when North Korea invades the South.

programme.title: First to Fight
programme.desc: When North Korea invaded the South in 1950 the United States military was not ready to deploy major and modern forces to the Korean Peninsula. The initial units sent used the same weapons from WW II.

programme.title: Battlezone: The Korean War
programme.desc: We approach this from the beginning in Korea when we had to control the civilian population...rehabilitation for tactical reasons. This is a very human, moving story and again points out our respect and concern for the individual.

programme.title: Battlezone: The Korean War
programme.sub-title: Big Picture: Armed Forces Assistance to Korea
programme.desc: For this film presentation in The Big Picture television series, American soldiers are shown as they lend a helping hand to Korea, a country torn apart by war. Americans have traditionally responded to the needs of friends in trouble. Here is a documentary about a gesture which started as an informal assist and has become a giant program for the rehabilitation of certain areas of Korean life.
